remarks: The factor theorem.  If a polynomial ` F ` has a root at ` A ` , then ` G = x - A ` is a factor of ` F ` (and the other factor is ` F quot G ` ).  This is part of Metamath 100 proof #89.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jul-2014.)
statement:
facth.1 $e |- G = ( Xp oF - ( CC X. { A } ) ) $.
facth $p |- ( ( F e. ( Poly ` S ) /\ A e. CC /\ ( F ` A ) = 0 ) -> F = ( G oF x. ( F quot G ) ) ) $.
